website_summaries.verdict: Poultry flavored toothpaste fights plaque and bad breath in dogs. Some owners say their dogs demand brushing nightly.
pros: Works well for keeping teeth clean
Most customers say their dogs love the taste of the toothpaste and want to use it regularly
cons: Some owners report the toothpaste has a rancid smell
Some dogs with sensitive stomachs may not have good results

customer_reviews.title: Not an "enzymatic" toothpaste; misleading website description.
customer_reviews.text: Ingredients listed on the toothpaste parcel, that was delivered to me, reveal no enzymes in its formulation. This toothpaste, instead, lists as its ingredients a recipe of chemicals and flavor additives. Therefore, it is unclear how or why this toothpaste is marketed as "enzymatic". It is not.
customer_reviews.author: Apoiuwerhpga

customer_reviews.title: Pearly whites
customer_reviews.text: This and a Disney Kids Princess toothbrush. Brush once daily and spare your canine companion pain and health issues from painful infected teeth. I got my last bottle in January, so it lasts a long while even when used daily like you should. A+++
customer_reviews.author: HealthIT

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: My little rescue loves it. So much that he tries to eat the brush. Here he is, just for your enjoyment!
customer_reviews.author: AmazonAddict

customer_reviews.title: My dog gives this 5 stars!
customer_reviews.text: My dog's favorite toothpaste! Every night he comes upstairs to "have his teeth brushed" and won't go to bed until this demand is met. He only likes this brand. Funny boy!
customer_reviews.author: FeFe

customer_reviews.title: Be cautious
customer_reviews.text: I don't know if it was the "enzymes" in this but my dog vomited both times after using this product. I wasted my money and my baby had to suffer. Never again.
customer_reviews.author: Lizzy

customer_reviews.title: Misleading Name - Not Enzymatic - More Like an Abrasive
customer_reviews.text: This toothpaste does not work with "enzyme" action as the title/name implies. It essentially sands down the dog's teeth using Hydrated Silica - which is a component of sand. Hydrated Silica can remove not only buildup on teeth, but also enamel. According to my interwebs research, over a long period of use - this can actually damage a dog's teeth.
customer_reviews.author: AnthonyNYC

customer_reviews.title: It works pretty well for my dog
customer_reviews.text: I've been purchasing this pet toothpaste for over three years. It works pretty well for my dog, however I can't say the same thing for the latest one that I got. At tooth brushing time my dog was shy away from me which was unusual. Then I smell something spoiled and rotten. Finally I smelled the toothpaste, and that's the culprit and explained why my dog won't go near it. I purchased this just over a month ago, so its too late to return.
customer_reviews.author: ChristyG

customer_reviews.title: used to hate getting his teeth brush
customer_reviews.text: My dogs loves this toothpaste! They look forward to teeth brushing time. Especially my toy Manchester terrier, that I rescued, used to hate getting his teeth brush. He too now loves it. I brush their teeth everyday. I can tell it looks better and their breath smells better too.
customer_reviews.author: NNguyen

customer_reviews.title: Had to throw away
customer_reviews.text: Product went bad and had awful odor, had only used it for couple weeks. Have read other reviews on this product just has an awful odor. Found out it's the same company that makes the hair armor flea and tick that you buy in Wallmart that product I believe I gave my dog seizures. This company is terrible and they are connected in the far east and I believe their product mix and the ingredients are from some foreign country, I think Cambodia. The parent company is Perrigo. They purchased sergeants pet products a few years ago, sergeants had a great name but this company is destroying it
customer_reviews.author: Terp226

customer_reviews.title: Smells rancid
customer_reviews.text: I'm very upset with your product!! I have purchased this over the years and never ever have there been a rancid order from your product! I brushed my dogs teeth and with in minutes he threw up! I'm not sure if it was a bad batch of tooth paste but it turned my stomach to smell it. The EXP date on this toothpaste was 02-20.
customer_reviews.author: Mary T. Levasseur

customer_reviews.title: So Good You'll Lick It Out of Your Brother's Mouth
customer_reviews.text: Where to start...One of the dogs was trying to lick this container before we even used it for the first time and it was sitting on the table. Then when we brushed the first ones mouth he loved it so much he came over during his brothers go and tried to lick it out of his teeth!
customer_reviews.author: MLP

customer_reviews.title: Dogs love it!
customer_reviews.text: I don't know what's in this toothpaste but all 3 of my dogs love it! They sit for me when I start brushing their teeth like I'm giving them a treat. My baby girl (Husky mixed) loved it so much that when mommy's back was turned she was biting it and licking up what came from the holes. I will give this product an A+ based on the reactions of my dogs. Must add that it taste so good that her brother (Lhasa Apso) is waiting in the background. The other brother (Chihuahua mixed) was chilling in the back but out of cameras way. He also gives it 3 paws up.
customer_reviews.author: REGENIA WARDTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: This toothpaste seems to have a cumulative toxic effect for some dogs
customer_reviews.text: I've been brushing my dog's teeth with this product every night for about three months. Her veterinarian recommended daily brushing. Everything was fine for awhile but then I noticed that she was starting to not like having her teeth brushed. But I persisted and we got through it. Then she started vomiting in the night. By the third night I made the association with this toothpaste and the vomiting did in fact stop when I stopped using it. I don't know which ingredient caused this, perhaps the sorbitol. I would not recommend this product, it is most definitely the cause of making my dog sick after long term use.
customer_reviews.author: E. Bramlett

customer_reviews.title: Product Quality Poor
customer_reviews.text: Something is now right with this order. The toothpaste is very dark, not creamy and doesn't smell like the past orders I have purchased. Even my dog really didn't like it. I opened the second tube of the three I purchased and it was the same. I will never order this toothpaste again. What a disappointment.
customer_reviews.author: Cindy Dawson

customer_reviews.title: My dog begs for it. No, really, begs
customer_reviews.text: This toothpaste (or whatever it's called for dogs) works very well, cleaning and whitening teeth and improving dog breath. My dog's usually smells like dead fish, so this is a big deal to me. But the real kicker is that he loves having his teeth brushed. If I forget, he will pester me (like dogs do when they want to play) until I get the brush and petrodex out. Then he gets on the couch, rolls into his back and waits. You just can't beat that. It's awesome.
customer_reviews.author: james

customer_reviews.title: Might cause seizures in elderly dogs?
customer_reviews.text: My mom loves this toothpaste for her pups so I bought a tube for my 11 year old cairn terrier. She seemed to enjoy the flavor which made cleaning her teeth easier. However, a week after using this toothpaste, she developed seizures. It could be a sheer coincidence that they coincided with the beginning of this product. But after spending over 6K on a brain MRI, echocardiogram, spinal tap, ecg monitoring where nothing remarkable was found, it makes me question if maybe some ingredient just didn’t work with her. Again, It could be a terrible coincidence but I thought I would share my personal story in the event a similar thing happens to your pup and you’re looking for answers.
customer_reviews.author: goodygumdrops

customer_reviews.title: Horrible for my yorkie!
customer_reviews.text: My dog got diarrhea the next day after using this toothpaste. I hadn't even given her very much at all. Tried a second time about a week later just to see and it happened again! She is 3 years old and had never once had diarrhea. Will not use again. I cannot recommend due to this.
customer_reviews.author: Faith Sanders

customer_reviews.title: Tartar no more!
customer_reviews.text: My dogs are getting a little older (9 and 7) and my older girl started to have bad breath. I inspected both their teeth and discovered that they had tartar build up. I decided to give this toothpaste a try as a first step before getting them professionally cleaned. After 5 uses their build up is nearly gone! Seriously amazing product. It does not require heavy brushing, so I use a soft bristle toothbrush (human) and use it to spread the toothpaste as evenly as possible. My dogs do not mind it as long as I give them a ton of praise during and after. I have recommended it to everyone I know who has a dog.
customer_reviews.author: Seraphim

customer_reviews.title: So Easy
customer_reviews.text: My puppy HATED the fresh breath toothpaste. I basically put brushing his teeth on the back burner for a year because he hated it so much. His teeth started to show some plaque though, so I gave it another go, this time with the petrodex enzymatic toothpaste. First, he loves the taste. I could use it as a treat easily. He allows me to brush his teeth with it without complaint. I introduced it first with my finger, and then with the soft bristled toothbrush. After one brushing, his teeth already looked better. I'm confident that this is a routine we'll be able to keep up because we're both happy about it.
customer_reviews.author: AnyCozy

customer_reviews.title: It’s working - best enzymatic toothpaste we’ve tried yet
customer_reviews.text: After reading endless forums on doggy dental care, this brand was mentioned quite a few times, so I decided to check it out. This is by far the best enzyme toothpaste results of all we’ve tried. In just a week of use we are noticing significant plaque reducing results. Our dog took to the flavor very well, and the smell is not offensive. We’ve been using a tiny amount in a dental rubber chew toy (that he uses for just 10 mins every day/every other day). I will continue to buy this brand from here on out.
customer_reviews.author: akadiane5

customer_reviews.title: Dental health is important to your dog's health
customer_reviews.text: Dental health is as important to canine health as it is to human health. Don't neglect either. I've been using this canine toothpaste for years on the advice of a series of veterinarians. Daily brushing with an ultrasoft human toothbrush has kept my dogs' teeth clean, thereby preventing have to have them cleaned very often, and keeps their breath sweet. All my dogs seem to have liked the taste, so I've given this toothpaste a five-star rating based on their acceptance of it. Important Note: Human toothpaste has foaming agents that are toxic to dogs. You cannot use your toothpaste for your pets.
customer_reviews.author: Dave Murray in Costa Rica

customer_reviews.title: Caused Vomiting, Diarrhea, & More!
customer_reviews.text: I would not recommend this product! Smells horrible & caused my dog to have severe diarrhea, vomiting, & lack of appetite. Stopped using it for a few weeks & GI issues ended almost immediately, but returned within hours of trying the toothpaste again. Came here to see if others had the same experience and lo & behold there are a lot of reviews saying the same happened with their pups when using this product. Will not use again!!
customer_reviews.author: Angel Harris

customer_reviews.title: My picky dog loves chicken and tolerates this chicken flavored tooth paste.
customer_reviews.text: My chow/lab mix mutt has had to endure a bottle of mint flavored tooth gel, so I wanted the next tube to be something that he would at least tolerate, if not look forward to. Mission accomplished, he does indeed like the chicken flavor toothpaste, and if it weren't for the chore of tooth brushing, he'd probably fully enjoy snacking on this paste. We use the paste once every other day. The paste smell out of the tube doesn't bother me, and his breath is not offensive and is pleasantly neutral smelling. The vet complimented the lack of tartar on his back teeth especially.
customer_reviews.author: ActualSize

customer_reviews.title: It might be too good
customer_reviews.text: This little guy wanted nothing to do with getting his teeth brushed until he tried this toothpaste. Now he’s obsessed with it, and he becomes a pest when I’m trying to clean someone else’s teeth. I did find out that it works better if I kind of press the toothpaste into the toothbrush. Otherwise the toothpaste gets licked away too quickly and doesn’t do much cleaning.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica

customer_reviews.title: This toothpase is so good that my dog brushes his own teeth now!
customer_reviews.text: So impressed with this toothpaste! Every dog I have owned has hated getting their teeth brushed. I mean a literal battle to get it done. In order to prepare for my new 4 month old Shih Tzu I did alot of research to make this a better experience. I ordered a multipack of assorted brushes to give him lots of options and from the reviews this was the tooth paste I went with. So glad I did, my 5 month old Shih Tzu now loves and even will get out his own toothbrush out to make sure he get his toothpaste. I couldn't be more please, this paste was a total game changer for me. Thank YOU:)
customer_reviews.author: Serena Christensen

customer_reviews.title: Not safe for humans=not safe for pets
customer_reviews.text: My dogs love this toothpaste. They line up in the bathroom every night and sit nicely to get their teeth brushed. BUT after using it for months, I noticed the precautions on the back of it that say: “keep out of reach of children. Seek medical assistance if it gets in contact with eyes.” If it’s not safe for humans, it is not safe for my dogs. We stopped using it immediately. It’s a shame. Looking for a natural alternative at the moment because the pups are disappointed at their lack of toothpaste diring brushing.
customer_reviews.author: J

customer_reviews.title: Dogs love the test and Vet says its doing the trick.
customer_reviews.text: I use with the Virbac single end tooth brush for small dogs. Vet said it is doing the trick. And my four little ones love the taste (chicken). They cringe when they see the tooth brush, but as soon as they get a whiff of the toothpaste they sit still and enjoy. Cost me $1000.00 vet bill on my 5yr old Yorkie because I was not brushing their teeth. I have 2 Yorkies and 2 Chihuahas and they all four get their teeth brushed daily. It is worth the money to make sure my dogs keep their teeth and stay healthy.
customer_reviews.author: tina a jones

customer_reviews.title: I should have read the ingredients first......
customer_reviews.text: The first ingredient is something that could possibly kill a dog.. it may not be likely, but im not taking the chance. (It's sorbitol) I will be returning.
customer_reviews.author: Teela

customer_reviews.title: Product looks & smells bad
customer_reviews.text: I have purchsed this product for years and my dogs loved it. I just opened a brand new tube and immediately noticed it was dark and the smell was strong/bad. I allowed my dogs to smell it. They turned their heads away.
customer_reviews.author: Judith S.

customer_reviews.title: My dog loves the flavor
customer_reviews.text: My dog HATES having her teeth brush. She will let me cut her nails, but when it comes time to have her teeth brushed, she fights back. My vet suggested trying poultry flavored toothpaste so we purchased this item. I will say that my dog loves the flavor. She will just lick it straight off the toothbrush. She still hates having her teeth brushed but now she doesn't make a disgusted face after I'm done and her teeth. Great product! Does it's job!
customer_reviews.author: Z and K

customer_reviews.title: It works
customer_reviews.text: I have used this on my Corgi's teeth for several years with good results. I alternate between this product and the gel plaque remover. He has discolored teeth and some plaque build up. I do not want to put him under anesthesia for teeth cleaning so I use this toothpaste and it is effective when used with a plaque remover. It is not a miracle, white shiny teeth cleaner, but it is good for maintaining teeth and not letting them get worse. If there is a significant amount of build up, this paste will not remove plaque. It is more of a maintain so it doesn't get built up preventative type care.
customer_reviews.author: Amy

customer_reviews.title: Saved me $1400
customer_reviews.text: I live in California. My 7 year old dog went to the vet and the vet wanted to clean her teeth. With sedation, and the cleaning the bill would be an estimated $1400 after cry laughing about how i cant afford to get me dogs teeth cleaned and failing at being a good dog owner I ordered this. After 1 use I noticed a difference. After a week its 65% improvement. I do her teeth 3 times a week. It says on the label to do it daily but I am too lazy. She likes the flavor and doesn't run scared. This stuff is great.
customer_reviews.author: T

customer_reviews.title: Excited to see the results
customer_reviews.text: My 10 year old applehead teacup chihuahua of course sticks her nose up at it. I didn’t expect her to like it because she doesn’t like anything but I am excited to see how the results are over time on her very few teeth left after having them removed two times. The results for others are amazing so I am excited. She used to use the gel which she seemed to like better but these results from other dog owners is the reason I bought this product. I will update this review in a couple months
customer_reviews.author: Brianna Antao

customer_reviews.title: I don't like the smell of it
customer_reviews.text: I don't like the smell of it. I couldn't get my dog to try it on my finger but he gets really cautious about things coming from tubes since he didn't like another mouth cleaner that we tried. I'm not fond of the paste being a bit thick - not quite like human toothpaste but more of a caramel thickness texture I suppose. Dog didn't seem to mind the taste and it left his breath fresher. I'm trying to be consistent with the brushing, I'll post an update on the actual state of his teeth when it's gotten more use.
customer_reviews.author: RiTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Love this Dog 🦷 paste!
customer_reviews.text: Works great for dogs with early stages of gingivitis. My 7 year old chiweenie has got some stinky breath, but if I am consistent about using this toothpaste 3-4 times a week, her breath and licks are much more bearable! Personally, I just bought one of those 4 or 5 pack toothbrushes for humans, that are meant to be used with activated charcoal (therefore the brush itself is extra soft), and she rarely has any bleeding. I would say the bleeding only happens if I haven't brushed in a few weeks. I can't wait to see how well this works when she has a professional teeth cleaning, and the gingivitis is gone.
customer_reviews.author: Marky Mark

customer_reviews.title: This is full of crap
customer_reviews.text: I bought this because I believed an answer in the question and answer section which listed the ingredients which were all quite natural. It arrived and when I saw all the junk in it, I tossed it right away. There is no way I am going to give my little Shih Tzu all that crap. I found another enzymatic toothpaste on amazon that has way less junk in it, and bought that one. Interestingly, it was cheaper than this one.
customer_reviews.author: jolie

customer_reviews.title: Vets rave about my pupper’s teeth
customer_reviews.text: I’m guessing on the flavour since it’s for my dogs but one in particular is crazy for this toothpaste. He loves his teeth brushed anyways. Our veterinarian recently retired and always commented how amazing his teeth were. A recent checkup had the trial veterinarian raving about his teeth. She said she had to double check his age because they are so white and don’t show his age. A few side notes: I brush both of my dogs’ teeth 6 days/week. I give them 1 Greenies dental treat each, every day. I *do* alternate with another brand of paste but they do seem to prefer this one.
customer_reviews.author: Jinxie

customer_reviews.title: Gross taste for humans
customer_reviews.text: Ok lets get talk about the elephant in the room first. DO NOT LEAVE this product on your bathroom sink unless you want to end up using it by mistake like I did. Dogs might like the taste but I didn't. LOL. Othewise, works like a charm.
customer_reviews.author: Jason Bradshaw

customer_reviews.title: Outstanding!! LOVE IT!!
customer_reviews.text: We have a Boxer and she gets her teeth brushed daily. We have tried many different brands and flavors. I appreciate and value reviews when making a purchase. This particular toothpaste came with many 5 star reviews. We can not believe how great tooth brushing is going with this brand. We picked the poultry flavor and she just sits in my husbands lap on the floor and she's perfect. Your dog's tooth health is vitally important to it's entire health. Please take 5 minutes out of your days to brush your pets teeth.
customer_reviews.author: JUDEE OBRIEN

customer_reviews.title: My dog likes this one and with regular brushing has had his gum problems reversed and/or stopped in progression.
customer_reviews.text: I tried a few different toothpastes for my dog after the vet recommended I start to brush his teeth because he was starting to show early signs of gum disease. This is the one he liked, so this is the one I have been using. I have been using it with rubber 'finger brushes' for the brushing. It has partially reversed the problems he had and while not returning him to his youth, it has made a huge difference and completely stopped the progression of the problem. I have not tried brushing alone (no paste) as a comparison. Even if it is just because he likes the flavor and tolerates the brushing, the result is excellent.
customer_reviews.author: GalCalif

customer_reviews.title: She LIKES IT!!!!
customer_reviews.text: It's like the commercial, if you recall Mikey likes it!!! When you have a picky eater and she actually does not balk at me putting this in her mouth it is a victory! My shih tzu loves it. Licks her lips.I followed my vets recommendation and use gauze and rub. My poor baby had eleven extractions because I was lax. No more I use this on her daily and she does not fight me at all.
customer_reviews.author: Tina Grossman

customer_reviews.title: Bootleg.
customer_reviews.text: I do not believe this is the same product that is advertised... As you can see the packaging and markings on the tube are different, the product inside is also different the consistency and color are off.
customer_reviews.author: Donna

customer_reviews.title: Terrible Toothpaste - Be Forewarned
customer_reviews.text: Ever since I switched to this toothpaste, my dog has had more foul breath, yellowing of teeth, and plaque than she's ever had, from the bottom of the tooth to the gum line! I'm switching back to Virbac brand. Her gums have now started pitting, despite me brushing her teeth every few days. It feels like I'm just spreading sugar on her teeth at this point...
customer_reviews.author: Leena C.

customer_reviews.title: Great toothpaste
customer_reviews.text: My Maltese has been using this toothpaste for a couple of years. It works really well and she loves the chicken flavor. It has been 2 1/2 years since her last dental cleaning and vet says she is good for several more months. I do brush her teeth daily which is, in my opinion, very important for my pet's dental health. Maltese have small mouths and small teeth so it's very important to me that her mouth is cleaned daily. She has never had bad breath, and I attribute that to daily care with this product. And finally, she comes running when I tell her it's time to "brush your toofies." :)
customer_reviews.author: Onewadsworth

customer_reviews.title: The rating here is probably not good
customer_reviews.text: Flavor? How am i expected to rate flavor of a product for my dog. I am NOT trying something that is liver flavored. Nooooo thanks. Scent? Well it's not the worst thing i smelled...but its for dogs so yeah. Doesnt seem GREAT. Easy to use? Well my dog hates getting his teeth brushed but i suppose its going to be tough to brush most dogs teeth. But hey, its toothpaste for the dogs...it seems to work. I can see it help almost instantly just from brushing the teeth. Looks to get plague off nicely
customer_reviews.author: Ryan

customer_reviews.title: LIKED IT?  MY GOLDEN TRIES TO STEAL THE TUBE AND EAT IT ALL
customer_reviews.text: I followed the directions and let My 12 yr old British Golden retriever sample it. With clenched teeth as not knowing why i had this red tube. Then lifted her left gums and rubbed the teeth. WELL THE NEXT 5 MINUTES LICKED MY FINGERS AND LICKED THE TUBE AND TRIED TO TAKE IT AWAY. It smells a little like a chicken cracker spread
customer_reviews.author: Long time happy customer

customer_reviews.title: Our dog absolutely loves this stuff.
customer_reviews.text: Our Chihuahua absolutely loves this stuff... to the point that she actually tolerates have her teeth brushed. TIP: start out by just putting a tiny bit on the toothbrush and letting your dog lick it off - I did this nightly for about a week. Once they get used to the toothbrush being the delivery system start trying to gently brush. Worked for me. I can't believe how much she likes this stuff. 5 Stars.
customer_reviews.author: 121517912a

customer_reviews.title: Product uncertainty
customer_reviews.text: This is how the package came. I didnt even open it. It was just like this. Toothpaste away from package. I dont know of it is Amazon's fault or the company, but this is not cool, now I dont know if it is used or just came like that or if it just like this during the delivery. So the product uncertainty is why I give it 2 stars... Update: I opened the cap and it was sealed. So that takes the used uncertainty out of the equation. That is way I bumped it to 3 stars. Will update after use of product and how my dogs teeth results are like.
customer_reviews.author: Mina Zaky

customer_reviews.title: Tastes like Chickin’
customer_reviews.text: Our dogs are starting to get a bit of tarter build up on their teeth. We give them chews but stay away from rawhide. The first time brushing their teeth as almost as much fun as giving them a bath. But now they line up and let us do our biweekly dental hygiene in them without a problem. You just gotta get past all the drool Last time we did this I tried some. Yup, Tastes like chicken. I won’t be giving up my crest but if we forget our toothpaste on a camping trip this would work in a pinch.
customer_reviews.author: JosephTop Contributor: Cycling

customer_reviews.title: THE only brand of dog toothpaste!
customer_reviews.text: I have a monthly subscription to this because it so great! I brush my dogs teeth every evening before bed and if I don’t he throws a fit. He loves this stuff. He’s only 2yrs old but I’m hoping this will give him a better quality of life as he ages. So far so good, pearly white teeth! Oh and he hates peanut butter and mint so all the other brands of toothpaste don’t work for him. I have tried. This should be the only brand of dog toothpaste!
customer_reviews.author: Katherine Hesterberg

customer_reviews.title: Buy this stuff right now
customer_reviews.text: Have three pugs. Dental cleaning is right up there with nail clippings. 😭😤🤯 Might as well be a contact sport. Till we got Petrodex. They LOVE this stuff. Dental cleaning causes them to squeal with excitement. And their teeth are noticeably whiter after just two weeks of brushing every other day. Like it so much we subscribed and are saving.
customer_reviews.author: Pug Poppy

customer_reviews.title: gave my dog terrible diarrhea
customer_reviews.text: I tried this for my dog a few months ago. The next day my dog (sturdy little rescue terrier who's very rarely sick) had terrible diarrhea. Following that he was lethargic for another 8 hours or so. I never used the toothpaste again until recently a friend said she thought it was great, so I thought maybe my dog's trouble had been coincidental...NOPE! Tried it again with the same result so It's going in the trash.
customer_reviews.author: K Harwood

customer_reviews.title: My Dog is OBSESSED With This Product
customer_reviews.text: I bought this (and a toothbrush) because my dog's jaw sets a bit off and because of it, all of the dental chews etc. are not keeping these specific teeth clean and tartar is starting to build up. Now, the teeth brushing is a work in progress because the teeth I'm trying to reach I have to get her jaw open which is difficult. But, let me tell you, SHE LOVES LOVES LOVES this product! When she sees the tube, she will whine and cry until I give her a little taste. So kudos to this manufacturer because the only reason she let's me put a toothbrush in her mouth is because of this product.
customer_reviews.author: Julie Hink

customer_reviews.title: I'm sure this is a great toothpaste, but I just couldn't get over the ...
customer_reviews.text: I'm sure this is a great toothpaste, but I just couldn't get over the smell. It made me want to gag! Brushing a puppy's teeth, you have to really get all up in his face. He's struggling, he's flailing... and with that smell, omg, what a nightmare. We did it for a few days, then I decided we just have to get a better smelling toothpaste for the sake of his teeth. I will say that our puppy enjoyed the flavor, so it did make brushing fairly easy.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan C.Top Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Amazing!!
customer_reviews.text: My dog LOVES this new toothpaste! The minute I opened the lid, he came over to sniff it and his eyes went wide lol. Needless to say he gives it a 5 out of 5 stars. It seems to be doing well. I've only had it for a few weeks. He make sure to brush his teeth nightly and had decided to get a better quality toothpaste. He is a miniature dachshund (2 years old) and doxies are known for having bad teeth issues. But I got lucky and he loves getting his teeth brushed! So far a great product! I would recommend for sure.
customer_reviews.author: Rachel R. Dyer

customer_reviews.title: Good Product - Does the Job.
customer_reviews.text: Been using this brand of dog toothpaste for a while and it does work in reducing plaque and tartar build up w/regular brushing. I use an electric toothbrush since the dog only allows 1 minute per side and need to get as many brushing stokes into that limited window as possible. The routine is to give some toothpaste to taste to calm the victim, then brush for 1 minute before I start to get push back, then give some more toothpaste to taste to stay calm and brush the other side. In 6 yrs, I haven't had to have the vet do any dental cleaning - she passes her annual dental exam each time.
customer_reviews.author: Cliff S

customer_reviews.title: made my 3mo old pups breath awful!
customer_reviews.text: he didnt even have a breath issue to begin with. 5mo puggle and i am new fur mommy. simply wanted to take the initiative to create healthy habbits for my pup. this was a mistake purchase atleast if your intention is to create fresh breath while caring for your dogs dental hygiene. i purchased another brand with meat flavor and mint scent and it did the trick. i would not recommend this product though it may serve its purpose in terms of cleaning.
customer_reviews.author: Nina

customer_reviews.title: Soft Stools
customer_reviews.text: I gave this product two stars because my lab really likes the flavor. The number one ingredient is Sorbitol. I did some research and it is supposed to be ok for dogs to have, but something in the toothpaste makes my dogs stools very soft/runny. I held off on my review until I was sure it was the toothpaste and not something else in his diet.
customer_reviews.author: CarolinaBlonde

customer_reviews.title: Magic Dental joy!
customer_reviews.text: Brushing my tiny dogs teeth has been a chore for both of us. She's a very good girl and reluctantly puts up with the brushing. WELL>>>>when I used THIS toothpaste for the first time, she smelled it when I put it on the brush, bounced over to me, and completely relaxed and enjoyed the experience. It was the most productive brushing which will bode well for her overall dental health. Great product! Thank you!!
customer_reviews.author: Mrs. BSK

customer_reviews.title: 2 weeks and already seeing a difference
customer_reviews.text: I have always brushed and scraped my dogs' teeth. Previously have used a product from another vendor which no longer exists! The Petrodex is yummy for my doggies, and even though my 13 year old collie (who came to us with bad teeth) has some areas prone to build-up, the Petrodex appears to have reduced and softened those areas. Believe me after 12 years of examining his teeth---I know exactly where to look in his mouth! There must really be something with the enzymes in this formula, that really works! Wish I had used it from year ONE.
customer_reviews.author: Think Again

customer_reviews.title: Senior dog Approved
customer_reviews.text: I have a 12 year old dog with lots of teeth issues. He has some health issues so I choose not to get his teeth cleaned and sedated, so I'm always looking at different alternatives. He doesn't mind the taste, I use a doggy toothbrush, and I think it works really well, he is pretty stubborn, but must like the taste because he let's me brush them without issues
customer_reviews.author: EJ Hill

customer_reviews.title: Works great, Rosie loves it
customer_reviews.text: Rosie, our rescue mutt, had developed significant tartar buildup, to the point where she needed it removed by the vet. Turns out she has a heart condition that makes sedation or anesthesia dangerous for her, so the last thing we wanted was to have to do that anytime again, so brushing her teeth became a serious matter. This seems to be the best toothpaste for her. She loves the taste - there's no struggle to get her to stay still - and it works very well. At her last clinic visit, our vet complimented how clean Rosie's teeth are, almost two YEARS since she had the cleaning at the vet's.
customer_reviews.author: Michal G. Osier

customer_reviews.title: My dogs look forward to having their teeth brushed
customer_reviews.text: I have been using this toothpaste for a year and the dogs really like it. The last tube I purchased had a defect in the tube itself. The seam of the tube was defective and toothpaste was coming out through the seam. I am hoping customer service will replace this. I will post updates as they occur. Update. Sentry has agreed to refund the price of the purchase. I appreciate the response from their customer support.
customer_reviews.author: R. T.

customer_reviews.title: good toothpaste.....packaging needs work
customer_reviews.text: My dog loves the toothpaste and it seems to work fine but every time I go to open a new tube the little tab on the sealer breaks off and I need to spend 10 minutes looking for my tweezers to pull the rest of it off. It happens every time I open a new tube! Either leave the foil off entirely or use thick enough foil so the tab doesn't break off.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: It works
customer_reviews.text: I tried the dental chews, but other than freshen his breath, our dog had brown fangs and irritated gums. I felt like the worst puppy momma ever. So I ordered this toothpaste. Our dog loves it. He sits by my side and lets me brush while he licks it up. His teeth really whitened up. I shared this story with our vet at his checkup. She cleaned the last little bits of tartar off his fangs. It only took her a few seconds. She told me I am doing a great job with this dog. We will definitely continue to use this product.
customer_reviews.author: Caliartist

customer_reviews.title: color of toothpaste and exact name of this
customer_reviews.text: I got this toothpaste in a timely manner(thank you!) but the color of toothpaste is deep brown which is very different from what I saw(it's a cream color)from manufacture's video. And also it said just Petrodex not Sentry Petrodex on the package. I want to know this is a fake or not and also want company to describe about the color so customers can escape from the confusing. Thank you.
customer_reviews.author: M

customer_reviews.title: My Dogs Love It & So Do I!
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this 3 weeks ago for my 13 & 16 year old dogs, and they love it! I never brushed their teeth before, but my vet pointed out excess plaque and gum disease on my 13yo that could be helped by brushing. Anyone with multiple dogs will tell you, what you do to one has to be done to the other. Now they follow me into the bathroom when I brush my teeth and wait for their turn. I wish I had taken before pictures because I'm already seeing a difference! My 13yo's gums look much healthier and my 16yo's teeth look less yellow.
customer_reviews.author: Joscelyn

customer_reviews.title: The dog thinks it's candy. Don't tell him!
customer_reviews.text: He won't let me go to bed until I've brushed his teeth. He gets excited when his toothpaste comes out and then he tries to eat it, so I have to hold his face closed while brushing. Since I've switched to this brand he now has pearly whites and only complains a little. I always give him a little treat when we're done, and he's begging for more candy every night. Dog provided the reviews on flavor and scent- I'm going to have to take his woof for that, but as to ease of use- it was impossible to brush his teeth with the minty dog toothpaste I started with. This stuff gets infinity stars just for that.
customer_reviews.author: SusieQ

customer_reviews.title: Dog tooth paste
customer_reviews.text: Didn't think it would make such a huge difference but it has. My dogs (have 4) all love the taste of this so much they actually hold still while I brush their teeth. I had to start keeping it up high in a cupboard because my Brazilian Mastiff kept sniffing it out and trying to eat the entire tube. Definitely would recommend this for anyone out there trying to brush the teeth of an impatient dog. Oh, and it does seem to be doing a great job on their teeth. So it both works well and tastes good!
customer_reviews.author: DJ

customer_reviews.title: My dog won’t tell me if he likes it but it is helping.
customer_reviews.text: Sorry - my dog won’t tell me what it tastes like or if he likes the scent. I squeeze some on a piece of gauze to try and clean his teeth but he’s never liked anyone to mess with his mouth. All I can do is my best. He’s a stinker.
customer_reviews.author: zorelda

customer_reviews.title: Dogs Like It
customer_reviews.text: Even my picky guy likes the flavor. Tube lasts a long time. Now if the process of brushing dog's teeth was easier :-)
customer_reviews.author: VT Dog Mom

customer_reviews.title: My puppy loves this
customer_reviews.text: My puppy loves it. She looks forward to her evening treat. She loves the taste and this is so important for teaching . I ordered a previous kind with no flavor and she hated it, but comes running for this product
customer_reviews.author: Jean Caola

customer_reviews.title: Our dog freaking loves this stuff
customer_reviews.text: So I can't speak to how effective it is as a toothpaste since we've not had our dog's teeth examined by the vet yet. I can say it helps a little bit with bad breath from stinky treats, but not a ton. However in terms of taste and ease of use, this stuff is great. Our dog L O V E S the taste, so much so that I have to really get toothpaste in between the bristles of the toothbrush and not just on the top otherwise he'll just lick it all off before I can brush his teeth at all.
customer_reviews.author: Madeleine

customer_reviews.title: Will continually repurchase
customer_reviews.text: I've purchased this item about 8 times now - will continue to purchase - my dogs love the flavor and it does a great job cleaning their teeth. IF you don't brush your dogs' teeth, you should - it is so important in their health routine. My 7 year old dog got her teeth cleaned about 4 years ago and didn't do well with anesthesia. This toothpaste has kept her from having to go through that procedure again. Her teeth still look like they did after they were cleaned. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: D. Anderson

customer_reviews.title: Best toothpaste for my pups!
customer_reviews.text: I've tried the toothpastes from Petco or Petsmart but they didn't really help cleaning my dog's teeth. My dog had plaque in her canines and it was becoming an issue. Until I found this awesome toothpaste! I brush my dog's teeth 3-4 times a week, and it's just unbelievable how little plaque she has on her teeth now! Plus, she loves the taste of chicken :)
customer_reviews.author: Maya

customer_reviews.title: My dog thinks it’s a treat.
customer_reviews.text: My dog loves this and comes running when I say “want your tooth paste”. I haven’t tasted it so I really don’t know about that part but I can say it’s really helping with her tarter build up. She has very little now and when we started using it she had quite a bit even though we use hard food, chews & treats for her. Great product. Wish you could see her running & jumping up on my lap for me to rub it on her teeth. Good buy. I will be back again.
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca

customer_reviews.title: Good value for the price
customer_reviews.text: This is twice the product that I can buy at the pet store for just a couple of bucks more. The dogs don't seem to object to the taste, and I haven't tasted it myself, so can't comment. The dogs just seem to object to having their teeth brushed, no matter what flavor the toothpaste is, but they do tolerate this one better than others I have tried. I brush their teeth every day, very briefly, before they get dinner and have not had to have dentals done in two years, which is a miracle in old collies. I know it doesn't make sense to brush BEFORE dinner, but that's the only thing that makes them hold still.
customer_reviews.author: Christa

customer_reviews.title: Amazing difference after one use!!
customer_reviews.text: We had started calling her Garbage Breath. I want sure if she would like the flavor, but I put a little in the tip of my finger and let her pick it off like a treat and she was all about it. We got a chew toy style tooth brush, I filled it up and she went to town. A couple hours after she cleaned it out, my husband noted excitedly how much better her breath was. I called her over and gave her mouth a good sniff... IT WAS LIKE NIGHT AND DAY!!! No more Garbage Breath, and I know she's going to be healthier for it.
customer_reviews.author: dmdrotz

customer_reviews.title: Amazing!! 100% would reccomend
customer_reviews.text: My dog absolutely loves this. I recently read an article that I should be washing my dogs teeth very frequently so I decided to go shopping, and of course on Amazon. My dog has always hated us touch his face or mouth for some reason so I was very hesistant, but I needed to do this for his health. MY DOG LOVES THIS STUFF. Every time I bring out the toothpaste he get on the bed ready in position. It’s so cute! The only reason I gave it 4 star is that it does not smell great, but I guess that’s the price to make my dog love the taste of the toothpaste!
customer_reviews.author: Stacy York

customer_reviews.title: Great product works well and the dogs love it
customer_reviews.text: Great dog toothpaste that is enzymatic, my dogs really do like it, and they do actually want to lick it off the toothbrush which is a mixed blessing, it's great that they love it so I let him lick it first Off the brush so it actually brushes their tongue, I think that helps with Doggie breath, and then they let me brush their outer teeth without much resistance, but sometimes it's good and bad because they do try to keep licking and eating the toothpaste which makes brushing the teeth a little challenge but I think it's worth it. The dogs love it and it makes the overall experience very good.
customer_reviews.author: Rottie fan 77

customer_reviews.title: Made my dog sick
customer_reviews.text: I was excited to purchase something with such great reviews, but unfortunately after 2 days our dog was vomiting dark yellow bile with just a pea-size amount used once a day. After becoming concerned, I read the reviews on this toothpaste since it's the only thing that changed over the course of two days and sure enough, others mentioned it made their dog sick too. I was hopeful based on the reviews, but unfortunately we will no longer use, as it made our dog sick.
customer_reviews.author: jb

customer_reviews.title: Wow -- this stuff really works
customer_reviews.text: Phenomenal. Our rescue dog had a lot of plaque due to neglect and abuse. We have seen a significant reduction in the amount of plaque around her teeth: we use this toothpaste once a day along with Plaque Off Powder that I sprinkle on top of peanut butter for her in the AM so she'll be sure to lick it around her teeth. Her daughter (who doesn't have the plaque problem other than a tiny amount since she was born here) also loves this toothpaste: they sit down and wait for their turn to get their teeth brushed.
customer_reviews.author: sophist015

customer_reviews.title: Effective
customer_reviews.text: This is more effective than the brand the vet sells. It's also stickier, so the paste stays on the toothbrush and teeth without immediately sliding off. You get a little more time to brush it around your pup's mouth. Because our dog will get excited and chew, shake his head, or otherwise end the brushing session, we don't get a thorough cleaning every time, so we brush his teeth every day. It's probably as effective as brushing every other day on a calm dog! Our dog hasn't had to have his teeth scraped in 5 years since we started using this brand. Happy dog, happy doggy mom!
customer_reviews.author: Priscilla Bettis

customer_reviews.title: Read the negative reviews, too.
customer_reviews.text: After purchasing this product and using it twice on my dog, I went back and read the negative reviews and decided that it wasn't worth risking my dog's health with this product. I have since discontinued using it; however, I would like to say that the tube that I received did not have a foul odor to it. While it may be a good product, I don't want to chance it.
customer_reviews.author: LKP

customer_reviews.title: Tastes nothing like poultry !
customer_reviews.text: I only bought this product for the high rating. It did arrive on time but I’m only giving it 3 stars because I just tasted it and it’s the furthest away from poultry flavor as it can possibly get. I hope that eventually my dog likes it and it actually works. I will rate this later on again on my dogs reaction and it’s dental performance.
customer_reviews.author: Frankiedee2020

customer_reviews.title: Dog loves it!
customer_reviews.text: I'm only giving 4 stars because I haven't used it long enough to determine if it is effective at aiding in the removal of tartar. However, most dogs absolutely hate to get their teeth brushed, that was not the case with this. She loves it, like getting a treat, after brushing she followed me around looking for more. After only one use her breathe was tolerable! It does to me have a funky smell..better than hot dog breathe though. HIGHLY recommend to anyone struggling to brush their dogs teeth.
customer_reviews.author: Peachy88

customer_reviews.title: A effective toothpaste for your dog that they will enjoy the taste of.
customer_reviews.text: It is difficult if not impossible to get enzymatic toothpaste in your local big box and small boutique pet stores. Most are not enzymatic. According to my vet and a local dentist this assists in getting the plaque off by essentially staying on the tooth and fizzling it away. Ask your vet of course to confirm but it works. My pups love the flavor and it helps me brush their teeth. I have 2 beagles. one senior at 10 years of age and one 3 year old. no issues with this as far as stools changing or digestion or sickness.
customer_reviews.author: Jason D. Griffith

customer_reviews.title: Best toothpaste, puppies cry for this stuff
customer_reviews.text: My dogs love this stuff. We started training them to brush their teeth since they were 8 weeks. Now they are pushing 6 months and they love this toothpaste. I’ve noticed it keeps their breath neutral. No strong smells and their teeth stays white. They get into a lot of stuff around the house as puppies but this toothpaste helps keep their breath tame. They love the flavor and it’s not stinky. They cry for us to brush their teeth now. I love this toothpaste, amazing! Just keep the tube away from your dog because mines bit the tube and their was holes on the bottle and so when we squeezed it, it squished out everywhere lol.
customer_reviews.author: Michelle T

customer_reviews.title: Dog lovers it!
customer_reviews.text: Me: Lexi do you want your toofs brushing time? Lexi gets all excited and comes sit next to me. The only problem is that she likes it so much she wants to lick it off the brush and it's not that easy to clean her back teeth or k nines At the end I would let her chew on the brush making sure she's getting all the hard to reach areas. Make sure to get a sturdy toothbrush than won't break if your dog likes to chew on it and always observe please
customer_reviews.author: Dahlia

customer_reviews.title: Dog approved, human tolerated
customer_reviews.text: The product doesn’t smell as minty as other toothpaste products for dogs, but this one is one my dog actually always wants to lick at. It makes it easier when they don’t hate the flavor. The consistently is like runny peanut butter, though, which can get messy.
customer_reviews.author: Devin

customer_reviews.title: I highly recommend this product.
customer_reviews.text: The product is amazing. I recently adopted a 4-year-old Yorkie. Her breath was quite terrible — gag reflex terrible. It was important to me that she associate this as a positive experience, so I started by putting a bit of paste on my finger and letting her take it as treat. She really enjoyed the poultry flavor. About a week later is when I started brushing her teeth. I use a silicon finger brush. She did surprisingly well! I noticed an improvement in her breath after just one use, and her breath gets better and better every time I brush (usually every other day). I highly recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: STarese

customer_reviews.title: Would buy again.
customer_reviews.text: I like this better then the CET brand. Seems to take off more of the stains right away. I brush his teeth everyday so not really bad. Not as sticky as the CET brand..Petrodex is more like normal toothpaste..He loves the taste and he also seems to like the CET brand taste more. My dog that is 10 does not like his teeth brushed but he tolerates it. I would buy it again. Four starts because have not used that long....will update later...
customer_reviews.author: bjjoggs

customer_reviews.title: My dog is a huge fan!!
customer_reviews.text: To tell you the truth, I have no idea just how well this product is doing for Archie's teeth, but it seems to help keep them clean. He should be writing this review, since he's a Huge fan -- boy, does he get excited when I tell him it's time to brush his teeth! He doesn't exactly open right up and hold still, but that's only because he's busy trying to eat it. Together, somehow, we manage to get him brushed and he feels he's had a dandy snack. His vet says his teeth are looking good, so what more could I ask? Archie and I recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Nancy NiceTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Disgusting
customer_reviews.text: I've been trying to get my dog used to this stuff for a couple weeks. The first time I gave her some she started shaking her head and spitting. She hates it and after smelling it I don't blame her!
customer_reviews.author: corig

customer_reviews.title: Helps motivate your dog to brush their teeth
customer_reviews.text: Been using for my small poodle mix rescue. It wasn't easy to brush his teeth at first, as my wife would have to hold him down as I brushed. The toothpaste help motivate him because he loves the taste of chicken. He got used to it and now sits down, moves in positions , and stays put. Just do it consistently. I brush his teeth 3 times a week. Highly recommend. My pup loves it!
customer_reviews.author: Earl Gaffud

customer_reviews.title: Dogs want to get their Teeth Cleaned !
customer_reviews.text: Our medium-sized dog has a plaque/tartar issue that hasn't been resolved with "dental stick" products or dental water solutions. Our Vet recommended daily brushing to avoid decay and extractions. We read reviews and picked this product. It has been great! Our dog likes the Chicken flavor and after a few days of training, now looks forward to nightly teeth cleanings! The paste flows easily from the tube, as a nice but not over-bearing scent and stays on the toothbrush while moving the brush to the dog. Easy transfer to the teeth. We have this as a Subscribe N Save item now !
customer_reviews.author: Steelers Shusko

customer_reviews.title: Good Toothpaste
customer_reviews.text: I have ordered two tubes of this toothpaste and so far, so good. I like the consistency, it's not too gummy or sticky. My three dogs seem to love the taste. The tube is a very good size and a very good value for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Terrier MomTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Not effective.
customer_reviews.text: Although my dogs likes the taste, it doesn't keep my pups' teeth as white as I want them to be. We brush their teeth every night and after using this toothpaste, we noticed significant stain as if their teeth are not brushed. For the price, this product is not as good as others.
customer_reviews.author: JayT

customer_reviews.title: Great product. Highly recommend
customer_reviews.text: I’m 3 uses my dogs teeth are SO much better I knew nothing about this not a friend told me and said when of I can’t always brush of dog gives me an issue just to get it in her mouth is good and it works she has brown behind teeth and already gone. Only issue is she ways or so fast she loves the flavor I don’t know how much is actually getting in her teeth or how it would work just putting it in her mouth.
customer_reviews.author: Adriana

customer_reviews.title: Love this stuff!
customer_reviews.text: My girl dachshunds go crazy immediately when I grab "their" toothpaste from the cabinet. They both LOVE the flavor and its scent is pleasing to us, the humans using it. We don't have any cavities in this family!!!! I just wish it wasn't quite so pricey... its about $9.00 a tube, otherwise its a 5 star overall!
customer_reviews.author: Adele Vogel

product_meta.title: Petrodex Enzymatic Toothpaste for Dogs, Helps Reduce Tartar and Plaque Buildup, Poultry Flavor
feature_bullets: DOG TOOTHPASTE: Petrodex Advanced Dental Care Enzymatic Dog Toothpaste helps reduce plaque and tartar formation.
PATENTED ENZYMES: With patented enzymes, this non-foaming formula of dog toothpaste does not require rinsing.
FIGHTS BAD BREATH: With regular use, Petrodex Enzymatic Toothpaste for Dogs helps reduce plaque and fights bad breath.
POULTRY FLAVOR: Dog toothpaste comes in a delicious poultry flavor that dogs love!
RECOMMENDED USE: For best results, brush using enzymatic toothpaste for dogs at least 2-3 times per week. Use a soft-bristled Petrodex toothbrush designed for pets.

Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
